isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: MERITOR WABCO WITH "D" VERSION ECU - AUTOMATIC TRACTION CONTROL (ATC)

svcsubsecinfo.para: Automatic Traction Control is an option available on ABS-equipped vehicles. It helps improve traction when vehicles are on slippery surfaces by reducing drive wheel overspin. ATC works automatically in two different ways:

item.para: If a drive wheel starts to spin, ATC applies air pressure to brake the wheel. This transfers engine torque to the wheels with better traction.
If all drive wheels spin, ATC reduces engine torque to provide improved traction.

svcsubsecinfo.para: ATC turns itself on and off, drivers do not have to select this feature. If drive wheels spin during acceleration, the ATC indicator lamp comes on, indicating ATC is active. It goes out when the drive wheels stop spinning ( Figure 12).

note.para: If ATC is installed, there will be an indicator lamp on the vehicle dash or instrument panel marked ATC, ASR, or Wheel Spin.

svcsubsecinfo.para: To determine if a vehicle has ATC, look for the ATC valve. It is mounted on the frame or crossmember at the rear of the vehicle ( Figure 13).
